function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Influenza transmission between humans takes place indoors within a narrow range of temperatures, where ah and rh move in tandem","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relationship between rh and transmission via droplets and aerosols, where rh affects their physics and chemistry","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incorrect interpretation of humidity levels may result in ineffective virus survival predictions and seasonality assessments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misunderstanding the impact of temperature on the relationship between ah and rh can lead to misinterpretation of environmental risk factors for disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Weak sustainability approach of srs promoting economic development over natural capitals","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent consideration of food and vaccines implications in fitwel","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Irregular circadian rhythm and concomitant pathologies weaken the immune system, increasing susceptibility to infectious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of detailed strategies for social distancing and maximum occupancy in buildings, increasing the risk of airborne cross-infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"During emergency situations such as pandemics, strategies referred to the built environment may be adopted in order to guarantee the normal building operation and business continuity.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher ventilation rates in the built environment may lead to higher energy consumption and emissions, contributing to poor air quality and potentially impacting people’s health.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Company policies are typically preventive measures, easier to implement, and likely to be adopted at early emergency.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussion of indoor environment strategies and their impact on building operations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incompatibility of strategies between different certification categories fitwel, well, leed","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of specific disease mitigation measures in certain certification standards , food and vaccines in well","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate measurement of airborne viruses in real-time","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased capability to measure
